    • Constructor Detail

      • Chessboard

        protected Chessboard​(int[][] board,
                     int gameStatus,
                     int color,
                     int movesLeft)

      • Chessboard

        public Chessboard​(int[][] board,
                  int color,
                  int movesLeft)
        Creates and returns a chessboard with specified parameters. Parameters are not explicitly checked and illegal parameters (example: board of illegal size) will result in unexpected behavior.
        Parameters:
        board - 8*8 int array, representing pieces. For board orientation and values check getBoard function.
        color - color of the active player
        movesLeft - number of moves until the end of the turn

    • Method Detail

      • getRuleSet

        public static int getRuleSet​()
        Italian rules (default): checks can only be made on the last move of the turn. Scottish rules: checks end the turn, regardless of moves left.
        Returns:
        Rule set used.

      • setRuleSet

        public static void setRuleSet​(int ruleSet)
        Italian rules: checks can only be made on the last move of the turn. Scottish rules (default): checks can always be made, but they end the turn.
        Parameters:
        ruleSet - Rule set used.

      • getInitialBoard

        public static Chessboard getInitialBoard​()
        Returns:
        Creates and returns a chessboard in the standard initial position

      • transformLetter

        protected static int transformLetter​(char s)

      • getChessboardFromFEN

        public static Chessboard getChessboardFromFEN​(java.lang.String FEN)
        Creates and returns a Chessboard specified in modified FEN notation (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forsyth%E2%80%93Edwards_Notation). Format is: board color movesLeft. Example: rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/8/8/PPPPPPPP/RNBQKBNR w 5.
        Parameters:
        FEN - chessboard in FEN notation
        Returns:
        Chessboard

      • getGameStatus

        public int getGameStatus​()
        Returns the state of the game. Two caveats that are a consequence of optimizing the number of times some functions need to be called: 1.) Draws that happen in the middle of the turn, by running out of moves, must be checked explicitly and handled by the user. 2.) Checkmates are only recognized in the position, if the checkmating move was played. If a checkmate position is put on board via a constructor, it won't be recognized as such.
        Returns:
        Game status - CHECK, CHECKMATE, DRAW, GAME, TURN_ENDED.

      • getMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Move> getMoves​()
        Returns the list of possible moves. These moves can be used to advance the game state, via "makeMove" function.
        Returns:
        list of possible moves

      • getBoard

        public int[][] getBoard​()
        Returns an 8x8 array, representing pieces on each chessboard square. First row matches row "1" on chessboard and so forth. Pieces are represented by constants (ex. PAWN - white pawn) and are different between colors (ex. PAWN_B - black pawn). NONE represents an empty square
        Returns:
        current game board

      • getColor

        public int getColor​()
        Returns:
        color of the active player. Either WHITE or BLACK.

      • setColor

        protected void setColor​(int color)

      • getMovesLeft

        public int getMovesLeft​()
        Returns:
        number of moves until the end of the turn

      • switchColors

        protected void switchColors​()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Chessboard string suitable for printing in the console. Uppercase pieces are white, lowercase are black.

      • isMoveValid

        public boolean isMoveValid​(Move move)
        Checks the validity of the move. Invalid moves can't be played.
        Parameters:
        move - Move to be checked
        Returns:
        is move valid

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove​(Move move)
        Plays the specified move on the chessboard. If the move is invalid, this call has no effect.
        Parameters:
        move - Move to be played

      • makeMove

        protected void makeMove​(Move move,
                        boolean calculateMoves)

      • reverseMove

        public void reverseMove​()
        Reverses the last move on the chessboard. If no move has been played before, this call has no effect. This function can only be called once in a row, as only one move is passively stored. If deeper history has to be traversed, use reverseMove(move) function.

      • reverseMove

        public void reverseMove​(Move move)
        Reverses the last move on the chessboard.
        Parameters:
        move - Last move played on this board. If the move provided does not fit the criteria, the effect is unpredictable.

      • reverseMove

        protected void reverseMove​(Move move,
                           boolean calculateMoves)

      • hasTurnEnded

        protected boolean hasTurnEnded​()

      • copy

        public Chessboard copy​()
        Returns:
        deep copy of the chessboard

      • getFEN

        public java.lang.String getFEN​()
        Returns:
        chessboard in modified FEN notation (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forsyth%E2%80%93Edwards_Notation). Format is: board color movesLeft. Example: rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/8/8/PPPPPPPP/RNBQKBNR w 5.
